    public class ProblemActivity
extends androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
implements android.view.View.OnDragListener, android.view.View.OnTouchListener
    Class to handle the delivery of each Parson's problem.

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Initiates each problem by fetching appropriate content view, tagging all lines as draggable, displaying 'NEXT' button as invisible, initialising media players for sound, and setting the text for each of the problem components.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState -

      • onTouch

        public boolean onTouch(android.view.View view,
                       android.view.MotionEvent motionEvent)
        Method to trigger the line dragging mechanism once a line has been touched. Adapted from: https://13mcec21.wordpress.com/2013/10/23/android-drag-and-drop/
        Specified by:
        onTouch in interface android.view.View.OnTouchListener
        Parameters:
        view - Line being dragged.
        motionEvent - What is the motion event when line is touched. Starts drag when motion event is ACTION_DOWN.
        Returns:
        True if drag is initiated.

      • onDrag

        public boolean onDrag(android.view.View layoutview,
                      android.view.DragEvent dragevent)
        Method to facilitate the dragging of one line from one layout container to another. Adapted from: https://13mcec21.wordpress.com/2013/10/23/android-drag-and-drop/
        Specified by:
        onDrag in interface android.view.View.OnDragListener
        Parameters:
        layoutview - Layout below which a line will be dropped.
        dragevent - Describes the drag event occurring as the line is being dragged.
        Returns:
        Should always return true.

      • displayProblem

        public void displayProblem(ParsonsProblem pp)
        Displays the data comprising a Parson's problem onto GUI components.
        Parameters:
        pp - The Parson's problem to be displayed.

      • generateParsonsProblem

        public ParsonsProblem generateParsonsProblem(java.lang.String topic,
                                             int skill,
                                             int numOfProblems)
        Method to build the filename for a problem for a given set of problem parameters, then to read that problem from file, from the assets folder in order to produce the Parson's problem data.
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic of the problem to be fetched.
        skill - The skill level of the problem to be fetched.
        numOfProblems - The number of variations of problems for that topic/skill combination
        Returns:
        The ParsonProblem object describing a random problem of the given topic/skill combination.

      • checkAnswer

        public void checkAnswer(android.view.View v)
        Method to check the correctness of the solution provided in the answer space.
        Parameters:
        v - The 'SUBMIT' answer button.

      • resetLines

        public void resetLines(android.view.View v)
        Method to send all lines in answer space to given lines space.
        Parameters:
        v - The 'RESET' button.

      • nextProblem

        public void nextProblem(android.view.View v)
        Method to trigger starting the next problem after successful completion of a problem.
        Parameters:
        v - The 'NEXT' button.

      • skipProblem

        public void skipProblem(android.view.View v)
        Method used to skip through problems by increasing or decreasing topic difficulty. For debugging purposes.
        Parameters:
        v - Skip forward and skip back buttons.

      • writeNewStudentLevels

        public int[] writeNewStudentLevels(int newLevel,
                                   android.content.Context context)
        Method to write to the student levels file the new skill levels
        Parameters:
        newLevel - The new skill level for the current problem topic.
        context - The context to which the file is written.
        Returns:
        The new student levels array.
